meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: She outplayed her opponent in chess by making strategic moves.
meanings.sent2: The team outplayed their rivals in the soccer match.
meanings.sent3: The young boy outplayed his older brother in a friendly game of checkers.
meanings.sent4: Her skills in tennis outplayed those of her competitor, leaving him stunned.
meanings.sent5: The underdog outplayed the reigning champion, causing a major upset in the tournament.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outperform someone in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: He outplayed his classmates in the science fair with his innovative project.
meanings.sent2: The singer outplayed all others at the talent show with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent3: The chef outplayed his own record by creating a new signature dish that amazed customers.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to practice outplayed the laziness that hindered her progress.
meanings.sent5: The student outplayed expectations by acing the difficult exam.

meanings.definition: To play better than someone else in a game or sport.
meanings.sent1: He outplayed his friend in basketball by scoring more points.
meanings.sent2: The team outplayed their opponents in the final game of the season.
meanings.sent3: The cat outplayed the dog in a playful chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to improve her skills outplayed any doubts she had about winning.
meanings.sent5: The athlete outplayed his previous performance, setting a new personal best.
